info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 12 at 5:48PM MDT by NWS Missoula
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of southeastern Powell County through 630 PM MDT... At 547 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 14 miles west of Helena to near Deer Lodge. Movement was northwest at 15 mph. HAZARD...Heavy rain, winds in excess of 30 mph, and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Deer Lodge, Garrison, Blossburg, Avon and Elliston. This includes the following highways... Interstate 90 between mile markers 167 and 188. Highway 12 Garrison to MacDonald Pass between mile markers 0 and 26. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. These storms may intensify, so be certain to monitor local radio stations and available television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service.
